segment.source: Use the topics in this section to learn about how to use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.
segment.target: Use the topics in this section to learn about how to use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.

segment.source: Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager
segment.target: Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: Enterprise Mode is a compatibility mode that runs on Internet Explorer 11, letting websites render using a modified browser configuration that’s designed to emulate either Windows Internet Explorer 8 or Windows Internet Explorer 7, avoiding the common compatibility problems associated with web apps written and tested on older versions of Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Enterprise Mode is a compatibility mode that runs on Internet Explorer 11, letting websites render using a modified browser configuration that’s designed to emulate either Windows Internet Explorer 8 or Windows Internet Explorer 7, avoiding the common compatibility problems associated with web apps written and tested on older versions of Internet Explorer.

segment.source: You can use IE11 and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager to add individual website domains and domain paths and to specify whether the site renders using Enterprise Mode or the default mode.
segment.target: You can use IE11 and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager to add individual website domains and domain paths and to specify whether the site renders using Enterprise Mode or the default mode.

segment.source: Enterprise Mode Site List Manager versions
segment.target: Enterprise Mode Site List Manager versions

segment.source: There are currently two versions of the Enterprise Site List Manager, both based on your schema and operating system.
segment.target: There are currently two versions of the Enterprise Site List Manager, both based on your schema and operating system.

segment.source: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) or the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1) tool, based on your operating system.
segment.target: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) or the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1) tool, based on your operating system.

segment.source: Operating system
segment.target: Operating system

segment.source: Schema version
segment.target: Schema version

segment.source: Enterprise Site List Manager version
segment.target: Enterprise Site List Manager version

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Enterprise Mode schema, version 2 (v.2)
segment.target: Enterprise Mode schema, version 2 (v.2)

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: Enterprise Mode schema, version 1 (v.1)
segment.target: Enterprise Mode schema, version 1 (v.1)

segment.source: Windows 10 supports both versions of the enterprise mode schema.
segment.target: Windows 10 supports both versions of the enterprise mode schema.

segment.source: However, the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) only supports the v.2 version of the schema.
segment.target: However, the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) only supports the v.2 version of the schema.

segment.source: If you import a v.1 version schema into the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2), it will save the XML into the v.2 version of the schema.
segment.target: If you import a v.1 version schema into the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2), it will save the XML into the v.2 version of the schema.

segment.source: For more info about the different schema versions, see Enterprise Mode schema v.2 guidance
segment.target: For more info about the different schema versions, see Enterprise Mode schema v.2 guidance

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Enterprise Mode schema v.1
segment.target: Enterprise Mode schema v.1

segment.source: Uses the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1).
segment.target: Uses the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1).

segment.source: For more info about the different schema versions, see Enterprise Mode schema v.1 guidance
segment.target: For more info about the different schema versions, see Enterprise Mode schema v.1 guidance
